title: Roman-Style Artichokes
introduction: Roman-Style Artichokes are a beautiful way to enjoy the fresh, robust artichokes found in the markets of Rome. These artichokes are cooked stem-side up, making a visually appealing dish that's perfect for any dinner table. With a stuffing of garlic, fresh herbs, and a hint of white wine, these tender artichokes bring a taste of Roman spring and fall right to your home.
ingredients: 1 tablespoon chopped fresh mint or 1/2 teaspoon dried marjoram
Salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.description: In a small bowl, stir together the garlic, parsley, and mint or marjoram. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in 1 tablespoon of the oil.

Gently spread the leaves of the artichokes and push some of the garlic mixture down into the center. Squeezing the artichokes slightly to hold in the filling, place them stem-side up in a pan just large enough to hold them upright. Pour the wine around the artichokes. Add water to a depth of 3/4 inch. Drizzle the artichokes with the remaining oil.
Cover the pan and bring the liquid to a simmer over medium heat. Cook 45 minutes or until the artichokes are tender when pierced with a knife. Serve hot or at room temperature.
